intro: Erigeron expansus, commonly known as the broadleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, meadows, and disturbed soils, often reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron expansus is known for its ability to thrive in various soil types and its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
